info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 4 at 5:37PM CDT until July 4 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS North Platte NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central Nebraska, including the following county, Custer.
* WHEN...Until 845 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 537 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ansley, Mason City, Berwyn, Weissert, Westerville, Intersection of Highway 183 and Cumro Road, Gavin Siding, Block Hill Basin, Cumro, Buckeye, Burr Oak and Arcadia Diversion Dam State Wildlife Management Area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT THIS EVENING
